employed, trader, professional, skilled labourer, etc.) and
perceptions (poor, good, better, best) are examples of
categorical data.
If the objective of the evaluation is to get insights, explain
phenomena and identify real-life situations and practices,
then the data needed are qualitative in nature and the method
of collection becomes qualitative.
Qualitative methods often used are interviews and focus
